alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 03 at 9:55AM CDT until April 08 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River Near Galesville affecting Trempealeau and La Crosse Counties. Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. .Heavy rain over the weekend fell on a deep primed snowpack, resulting in increased snowmelt and runoff. Rivers are expected to crest in the next 1 to 2 days before slowly falling through the week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 16.3 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.3 feet on 05/03/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1100 PM CDT.
